meanings.sent1: The fuscous clouds covered the sky, signaling an impending storm.
meanings.sent2: The forest floor was covered in fuscous leaves, creating a mysterious atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: The fuscous cat blended perfectly into the shadows, waiting to pounce on its toy.
meanings.sent4: Her mood was as fuscous as the storm clouds, brooding and heavy.
meanings.sent5: The old, fuscous house loomed ominously in the moonlight, casting eerie shadows.

meanings.definition: Tending to be dark or obscure.
meanings.sent1: The fuscous alley was dimly lit, making it a perfect spot for clandestine meetings.
meanings.sent2: His fuscous intentions were hidden behind a charming smile.
meanings.sent3: The fuscous plot of the mystery novel kept readers guessing until the very end.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were a fuscous labyrinth, difficult to navigate and understand.
meanings.sent5: The fuscous figure in the distance seemed to melt into the night, a ghostly presence.
